verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. It's been just over a week without bupe.
I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. I went from daily half teenth IV dope to nothing after a week of using gradually reduced doses of bupe.
After 15 years I'm having to learn a totally new skill!
In less than three weeks I'll be a year clean.

I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place. I relapsed by starting to use Kratom and then ventured into RC benzos as a way to get off Kratom, but of course that spiraled into abusing both and graduating to harder opiates as well as filling my adderall script.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. ... For the past 4-6 weeks I was trying to go about 4-5 days before using again, but wasn't really lowering my doseages.

The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day. ... At the end of week 2 I probably could have picked myself up and been somewhat productive, however you really start to crave sobriety and I knew the Kratom was dulling lots of emotions still.
Many know I have been dealing with a tough addiction and recent withdrawal. I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day.
I've been 4 months sober, I'm doing better now with my cravings... This is the first time in my life I feel like I'm making real connections with people.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love.
haven't had any opis in months
I am in the thick of wd. (current state of withdrawal), but also "yay!! Day three without opiates or xanax!" which indicates recovery from withdrawal, and is in the past tense.
I was terrified to give up the pills... The oxy and benzos ruled my every waking moment. (past tense recovery language)
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
I am happy to be here, sober .
I've never used a needle. Why? Seriously. I just want a "normal" friend.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel. This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
I used to run one in r/opiates

I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life. I’ve gotten two jobs (one of which was my dream job of teaching). I’ve moved out of my parents house into my own place. I have a girlfriend and am in an actual healthy relationship for the first time in my life. I lost 60 lbs of body fat, stopped all blood pressure meds, max bench: 375 squat:395 dead: 455 overhead:225.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...What a difference a year can make.
I’m officially one year clean from opiates.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse, Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9.

I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours and figured I'd spew some shit out about progress that might help someone... Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild. ...it was scary and still is... but it's the end of a shitty chapter in my life.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
Coming up on two weeks later today... Getting a lot of exercise. Haven't missed a day of work. Sleep is trying to return slowly.
This past weekend was better than the last... Nothing has felt very pink or cloud-like thus far. Just sticking to my daily regiment/diet etc and waiting for a wave of reprieve from this next phase.
I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point.

Closing in on 3 weeks, Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend? Whatever the fuck that means. I'm waiting for that one night where I just conk out for 8-9 hours so bad.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats... Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
Yesterday sucked but it's all good. Another day down
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain.
Had my ups and downs. But this time I'm real. Day. 3. At work early. Feel OK.
I've gone further than I thought I could, I've been browsing here it really helps. Every. Minute. Every. Hour. Each one is one closer to being better.
I feel so much better than just yesterday. I think I can do this.
Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading. I dont want in the least to be that person.
Day 4 in tha books! Can't believe it!
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
It's been a month and a half. I feel alive. It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better.
Anyways, at anytime I keep at least 40 pounds of poppyseeds incase the site I order from gets shut down, or something gets lost in the male, by doing this, I haven't WD'd in close to 2 years,
I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then "just for the weekend" myself back into active addiction.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I've always been a very prideful person... I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit. I went from being a junkie to being a contributing member of society, with a great family and career.

I've dealt with it with ice and NSAIDs, chiropractic care, acupuncture and massage... I've been sober, my shoulder had hurt pretty bad every day. ...My GP had said it was tendonitis and it would heal, but it's been about 6-8 months of pain...

The memory fades as time goes by. I doubt the memories will ever disappear completely, but I liken it to the memories of an ex-girlfriend... When you first break up, it is pretty much all you can think about- just like dope. But as time passes, those memories become less often, and also less detailed.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.

Clean for over two years... (past tense recovery) and Why am I still searching this shit. (present tense use, but in the context of someone who has been clean for over two years, implies a struggle with relapse)
I've been clean for two years, and my drug of choice is and always will be heroin. I haven't tried to get any dope, or even any painkillers.
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
I've been clean for two years
But it's been so long, that if I were to try to cop shit on the street I'd probably have a rough time. Looking too damn healthy after two years clean.
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three...
So I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier.

I could have used all that money for clothes, food, and new kicks. I could have spent it on my girlfriend who cried in my arms when she found out about my lifestyle and begged me to stop. Well, I'm finally listening. Good bye heroin, I might miss you but I ain't taking you back.
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday, my son is almost 8 weeks old, I'm gaining so much in my life and I'm actually happy, so why do I still want to get high?
I’m also currently in sober living due to my conditions of release/deferred disposition and will have just over 2 years clean when I can leave here.
7/18/16 was the day I actually got sober. The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin.
I no i need to pick myself up as soon as i can.
Today i am 15 days off heroin.
Today i am at day 20 heroin and alcohol free.
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol, Day 34 Heroin free
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free.
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free.  i have never made it this far before with heroin and alcohol.
So i would have been on day 32 off heroin but i ended up going back been using most of the day.
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting.
I am day 10 off heroin... been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am on day 15 off heroin.
I have been in hospital nerly 2 weeks due to attempting suicide. I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin.
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months, I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl. I was released from rehab
I finally decided to listen to everyone on here, and all of my counselors and check out NA.  42 days later, I'm happy to say that I've been to 42 meetings, and I'm a grateful RECOVERING ADDICT.
With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
I go to 8 meetings a week, and have 62 days.
"...it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person."
Life keeps on getting better. My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
I have four months clean today. These four months have been the hardest I've ever worked in my entire life. The longest I used to have was 39 days and the entire time I was white knuckling...
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!
A little over six months ago, I remember getting strung out in a public bathroom on the boardwalk in Huntington Beach, California. This was the last time I hope I would ever use heroin.

Today I’ve got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again.
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). 5 of those months I spent in a behavior corrections facility or "TC". I'm also in a drug court probation program.
I've decided to quit opiates starting tomorrow after eight months of use
I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I was doing so well, was already through the worst of the WDs. I have no willpower, I only hope that come tomorrow I'll be able to continue with my plan for sobriety in the new year.

UPDATE: Decided to hold off for now, took a gram of gabapentin which helped a lot, planning to use benedryl to get some sleep tonight as well. If I do decide to use the dope I'll probably plug and hope I don't end up in the ER with doctors trying to fix my ass.
I quit dope about a month ago

I was heavily addicted to heroin last year but have been clean since June 14. I took some tramadol on friday, more on Saturday, skipped Sunday, used Monday, skipped yesterday, and yesterday I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.

I feel that going through the withdrawals combined with not having any crutches will give me some enlightenment and allow me to completely focusing on recovery instead of worrying about my next nic fix.
I used yesterday for the first time in 119 days, and again this morning.
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really.
As of October 12th I was officially two years sober
Slowly saving back up to rebuild it now that I'm sober.

Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. Symptoms have been managed with Lope for the first 2 days, and then nothing stronger than an ill advised couple Benadryl on day 3, and a few advil.
I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years.
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update. Insomnia is starting to fade, restlessness no where near as bad, and the bit of mania I had last week seemed to have passed.
So I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day.
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit

12 year off and on opiate user with ~3 years as longest clean time, coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years (starting 300g poppy seeds/day, going to 2.5lbs seeds/day) ... GI issues better now (4 mos. clean)
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.
It's almost day seven. I am sober. I am alive.
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done. Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep. Hold on guys, we can kick this shit! One. Week. CLEAN!
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
Still free and clear... My body is like an old, tired sock... it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
Four weeks. I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
Six weeks was miles in the future, never thought I'd get here. Here I am. ... My brain must be starting to make happy chemicals again.

I have been out with family and friends, walked in nature, went to a concert, held hands with my love, played with my kid, did my taxes, did some exercises. I remember how shit it was most of the time, how sick I got, how needy I became.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track.

Still clean as a whistle. I went to the pharmacy today and they had just gotten a shipment of painkillers... interesting test, talking to someone about my script while a large quantity of opiates was six inches from me. I actually asked them to move the bottles.
Everything We Think We Know About Addiction Is Wrong - In a nut shell, this video explains that addiction is not about willpower or moral failing, but rather a complex disease. (x post from r/videos)
I have two years sober today... Sobriety is fucking crazy. 2 years feels like 10... and it keeps getting better.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.

I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.
I had ruined a lot of relationships and was on the brink of losing my job. I was addicted to opiates for almost 10 years

I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit. My family still see me as the piece of shit I use to be but I can honestly say that I have done a completely 180 and would not even dream of the things I may have done before.
So, I have been clean for 12 days other than 4 days ago I got a bag. I just don't have the money for it right now.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months.
we've recently been trying to quit, I've been having a much easier time than her (basically through my wds and hardly craving)
Since going cold turkey a bit more than a week ago I’ve hardly had any cravings for the stuff.
My friend od’d on methadone last summer, just got arrested for possession half a year after the fact because I was too busy giving cpr to hide my bottle.
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since

Pretty insecure about it cause I only really make joke music. Being serious scares the christ outta me... Anyways lmk what you think, any constructive criticism is accepted with open arms. Pretty new to this music thing.
it's about my mindset when I was using
I'm over the worst why go right back.
I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me.
Still NO SLEEP!!!! But it's a better day.
I can tell the difference. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.
and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
Over a period of six months I went from 14mg-2mg. Until without my doctor's supervision or knowledge decided I had enough of the shackled and jumped off the subs at 2mg.

Tried to cold turkey approx 8mg sub last year went a month clean and I just couldn't bear it anymore.
Two weeks ago I gave a short 7 sub taper a try. I switched to kratom for about 2 months.( was previously on sub). Using about 30g of kratom a day to maintain so I had a bit of a heft habit. 
Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too.
Long story short, it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
By the time I stopped doing opiates I could eat a 100 ug fentanyl patch and be normal. Shooting dope soon followed and it got really bad but now i'm clean.
I never get withdrawals; I used to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

I healed greatly and was actually sober for a while. Man did I enjoy that time and I look back on that as what I want for my life, I have my biochemistry degree now but working at a call center to save up and move to a region that has better careers for my passion.
I just got out of my 2nd stint in rehab today and my mother is sooo supportive. I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean
So I have been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days.
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.

I remember endless aching
Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking
anything to stop the shaking,
Anything i'd found
Thinking nothing, feeling hollow
planning all the highs to follow
all the pain and pills to swallow
stolen; hidden; downed
I remember darkness creeping
up and out and sinking, seeping
So I was thinking yesterday listening to this podcast about a life story from a former addict who actually turned their life around and now has a masters degree, a family, etc, and is doing great.
damn, was a dark individual during those times. hahaha, I can't even believe I wrote that considering the change within my self over this past year.
On to rehab, it was my second one. The first one I planned on using as soon as I got out and I did. This one I wanted to but at the same time, I can't do this to my mother anymore.
This withdrawal thing didn’t work so good in the past,
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away. They make the W 80% better, I am at day 3 of W but it feels like day 1.
I am clean now, Five days ago I did two shots of heroin... I have been clean for a few months

I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself. I mean it is still shitty but not to the point where I can’t function, and that makes me able to do some normal erryday stuff.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
I just relasped 2 weeks ago after being 8 months clean so I've been using for 2 weeks now obviously.
last September I went to rehab, ended up staying clean for 8 months, and relapsed in June and been using for two months
last September I went to rehab, ended up staying clean for 8 months, and relapsed in June and been using for two months
On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep...
This is not my first rodeo with recovery though, but my first time getting clean without rehab( just got kicked off my moms insurance).
Just hit day 8 of quitting so I have been officially clean for a week now.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work.
I just came off a 5 month run a month ago. Made it through withdraws and had 15 days completely sober.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean... It’s starting to become a quality of life issue at this point.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life.
I’ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). I’ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now,

My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Something I could never do even in my other quit attempts so I guess I’m all in this time.

I've been working a lot lately and I hate my job so this coming Monday I'm registering for school so I can go back in September. So August 1st I'll be quitting my job and going back to school full time.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
I’m clean now with 25 days sober
Anyone on here right now that is sober or looking to get sober

I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), and need help with my car (one of my main using spots). Today I decided to completely clean out my car head to toe trying to make sure all drugs and drug paraphernalia are out of my car so I’m riding clean
DONT COP AND DRIVE HIGH AF! (emphasis on not using opiates and driving)
Im 90 days sober. My main question here for my people in recovery is what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself?
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick and never went back.
I was clean for a while but a series of unfortunate events lead me back to a needle in my arm.
So I just started my suboxone after a 6 months binge, and I'm honestly suprised it kept me outta WDs.
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough.
It's my first day sober, again.
I went last night to my first NA meeting in years and it was awesome! Met some great people and ran into an old friend. I really liked the format, and it was at midnight which was really helpful.
Shared for the first time at NA last night. Got lots of hugs, phone numbers, and the white book.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! I'm clean another day and thankful for that!

I've really grown to love my home group! I went to the mall and splurged a bit on myself after IOP today. ... It was really nice not thinking, "oh I've got dope money!" but rather I'm going to go walk around the mall and get a coffee.
But, I am clean, and life is good! ... We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. ... This will be the first trip I have every taken sober...
It's day 59 for me. Yesterday I had a big surprise; I graduated from IOP! ... So now I have my certificate, and I, feeling pretty good!

Still going to a lot of NA meetings... Still do key tags at my Friday night homegroup, and I just started with HNI. Will be bringing meetings into a local detox facility the second Tuesday of every month.
It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates, ... It snowed today for the first time that I've ever been sober. It was awesome!

I finally asked for help, and started being honest. Honest with my family, with my friends, with my therapist, and most importantly with myself. It was the first time that I truly accepted that I was indeed an addict, and that I couldn't do it by myself.
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years it's like I've aged 10 years.
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
After a year of daily use, I am done with these fucking useless pills and the useless fuckers who I have to deal with in my life.

My habit was manageable, but I was dating the craziest girl in the universe.
I broke up with the crazy girl... my habit exists with me
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
I know I don't need to use.
Smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
Went back for that one last time. Slept the first 12 hours. Unable to keep any food or even water down.
I just hit 96 hours into my current detox. Feeling a little more human. Had a long chat with my Fam last night. Wasn't completely open but was open about how much I was struggling.
I'm barely 100 hours into my detox but I'm just thinking about last Wednesday around noon, three hours after my last dose,

I leave for an in-patient this afternoon for 30 days. Not exactly looking forward to it but looking forward to the business of getting my shit together and perhaps finally working at some of my root issues.
I had been clean since February 22nd but was at a point where I knew if I didn't do something drastic that it would only be a matter of time before I picked up again, like so many other times.
I'm an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22), I'm tripping balls.
Hi. I'm still clean after 6 months.

Hello, I love browsing this sub even though I have been clean off heroin for 7 years and some change. ... After trying NA and all that and never making 60 days of being clean, I was in the suboxin program multiple times. I had finally made it, I thought, had a job, a car, was selling OxyContin in 09 and taking subs, had money,women, dope was never sick and after spending 5 hours trying to find a vein one day I just had enough and stopped.
I'm a ex homeless junkie who managed to kick a 8 ball a day habit on 9 suboxin.
I used to be quite active on this sub but got clean for close to a year. Well I relapsed and it turned into a three month bender.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point.
I'm almost to the other side of this and can't wait for freedom! Onto day 5!
Today is day 10, I slept 6 hours STRAIGHT last night, and woke up without the deep bone chills. I was so happy I cried.
used to share my opiate inspired artwork here now and then, just celebrated 18 months clean

I have been opiate free for a respectable amount of time... I wasn't ever a huge gamer, but twice a week I would be able to sit in front of an Xbox or computer for a couple hours and indulge in fantasy world.
He was great. The thing is, I coached him through his kick while I was still in the depths.
When we don't eat healthily our entire bodies pretty much shut down and we both become very tired, irritable, and lack motivation.
So here I am, 60 days clean today.
Just out of curiosity. I feel like getting to a meeting and expanding my support group a little.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.
I've been in and out of recovery since '09 and this is the longest I've managed to stay clean.
I've been sticking it out, and great things are happening in my life right now. I'll be getting my license back this week, and hopefully getting a car in a month or so.
coming off a 3 week heroin binge... expecting to be ready to die in about eight hours
havent used one of these in about a year.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
Time to call the dope boy.
I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.
I haven't had a dream about using in almost a month, ... I'm on track from tapering down from 16mg to 2mg of suboxone daily.
i stopped taking it for a day and a half because i hurt my knee at work, and over the weekend i've probably taken about 80mg-120mg of oxycodone
haven't really dabbled in the dope scene since february

get the once a month "got a patch for you" text a full week early. Patch guy is also a pizza delivery guy! Excited to get the super rare "2 bird one stone" achievement in the opiate world, where it is usually "no birds and you owe me 5 stones."
He used to sell A LOT of weed but he's straight now.
im 9 months clean and i have grown to be so grateful for the life i live today but damn, i could be having the best day ever and sometimes i just miss partying and getting high.

I was physically addicted and was basically using to not be sick so I could function, go to work, etc, you know how it goes. ... I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
Using was fun. This is my weakness.
I have 93 days clean today!! Huge accomplishment for me, this is the longest I've been clean ever.
I've been having a ton of anxiety and have been spacey as fuck. Am I seriously in gabapentin withdrawl?

I've been off opiates for 26 days now, physically back to 100%, but my gp gave me gabapentin to help withdrawl three weeks ago and last night i flushed then down the toilet because I caught myself abusing them.

So I had 31 days yesterday and threw it all away when a coworker offered me free vicodin. He had a bottle with him he didnt want and offered them to me and I popped 4 of them without hesitation...Here I am, back to day one.
Just hit 30 days clean. Was using opiates on and off for about 3 years, alternating between norco, some tramadol, and lastly codeien.
I'm happy to get coffee, talk recovery, etc.

55 days sober today and man, it is still tough! I have some great days but today I've been sore all over and anxious like crazy! The last few nights I've woken up gasping for air in a total panic for no reason at all.
Since getting clean, I've had extreme anxiety and frequent headaches.
So I’m almost 7 months clean and I’m just having the hardest time. ... I was only using short acting pain pills, no heroin or methadone, albeit I was using norco/codeien for about 4 years prior.
Just wanted to pop in and say I’m a few days past 7 months of complete sobriety. My days are SO much easier to manage.

I've been prescribed benzos for 7 years and they are afraid to take me or they won't take me until I'm detoxed off of them but I'm sorry just one does not come off of benzos everyday for 7 years in 5 days while trying to detox off of heroin, it's a recipe for death,
I started feeling better about 4 hours after I took the suboxone, so I was successfully induced and was almost out of complete WD
I finally got off of dope using a sub taper. Coming up on 6 months clean from heroin/fent.
EDIT: I am 3 months clean now. 2 months was spent on replacement therapy. I was an addict for 3 years.
I remember being happy every single day.
I have been off opiates for 3 years now thanks to kratom & a shit-load of willpower.
I decided to quit about a month ago and for the first time, I felt like I was mentally done with the shit.

I've said this before and I'll probably say it forever, but everyone in this community has helped me immensely whether they know it or not. To anyone out there still in that dark place, you won't be there forever, you can have it all if you just want it bad enough.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.

I have 135 days today... I'm still pretty early into recovery and as everyone knows, our coping skills aren't the sharpest during this time. ...I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA. I'm ridiculously proud of this.

I just looked back on a post I made on r/opiates when I was just about to quit fentanyl...that I tried, that I made it farther than I ever believed I could, and that I DID end up getting my life back.
I'm so fortunate to be clean and have a warm bed in a nice apartment with a full stomach.
I have 16 months clean as of Monday, and I'm going in for oral surgery tomorrow because the worst of my many bad teeth has been keeping me awake for days.

72 days in an in-patient facility. I feel like a new person altogether. Its hard to view the pictures here and read the posts without feeling uneasy and anxious now. Funny how that shit changes. I used to get off to this subreddit but it just makes me nervous. I guess thats the meaning of "being done."
I've been off this sub for about 8 months now due to getting my act together and getting sober.
I was on opiates for about 2 years after my accident, and stupidly decided to quit cold turkey instead of taper off.
This is the last time I will go through this.
Finally deleted dealers' numbers. Man they really tried to talk me out of it! That was hard but I feel a lot better.
Anyway, usually my dreams are straight up horrible in early recovery,
I've blocked his number along with a few others, and told him not to contact me anymore and that I'm clean now. ... I am so grateful that I have no desire to use. I'm finally over the worst of WD
I've been clean for a few months.
So, I'm two weeks sober tomorrow. I went to rehab and just got out last Tuesday.
I've been clean over a month now but when I went to rehab everyone there told me that they could get high in their dreams and that it was weird that I couldn't.
I've continued to stay clean, I've bought a car and i've dealt with the financial ruin that I have caused. I'm pretty proud of myself.
I was clean from heroin a year on May 22nd.
I seriously haven't looked at this sub in about a year.
My sobriety date is 9/14/14! I'm 27 years old. ... Our main message is that it's possible to be young and clean, and still enjoy life to the fullest!!
One of our writers, Johnny, just got a whole year clean
I think you guys might like it! (referring to a past blog post), LOVE YOU ALL!!!
Meditation is a tool that my friends and I have found to be super helpful in staying clean.
We believe that Star Wars is actually super deep, and wrote up this piece on how the Last Jedi relates to being clean and sober.

A lot of us who get clean and sober have this common experience of finding out who we really are as people. My good friend Joffrey has been clean for over 5 years, and he wrote his story for our blog.
having 7 months, 7 months clean and sober
but he's been clean for about a year now and wrote about how he's overcome his fears while in recovery
My friend Aly, who's been clean for over 3 years,
When I was actively using, ... My friend Kimberly is dual diagnosed and has been clean/sober for almost a year.
They're both young and have multiple years clean and sober.
Check out this article by my friend Aly about what her journey has been like for the past 4 years!
My friend Cassidy wrote this article sharing her experience, maybe someone here can relate!
I've been clean and sober for over 4 years.

i have 59 days and am almost done with the fourth step. ... i've spoken to two other guys i'm really close to and one says he doesn't believe it because he's known him (aa sponsor) for a few years and said to keep him since it's working.
so it's 78 days sober from everything. besides cigarettes. ... celebrated my 24th birthday sober by going to a meeting and taking a burning desire and then fellowshipping at a diner afterwards.
five and a half months ain't goin' out like that.
it was yesterday, besides a bunch of wasted brahs moshing. shit is annoying sober.
shot dope for the last time January 19th of last year if I am not mistaken. have not had a drink or a drug since.
Three years ago I thought three months was impossible. ... I went through the 12 steps of AA in my first three months, and have continued to live more or less along those lines.

I celebrated 4 years with two friends of a few years in Belgium eating chocolate, fries and waffles and sightseeing. I have been able to do so much since I've gotten sober from IV heroin and everything else.

In the months after his death my use spiraled completely out of control, I went from using a couple of times a week to every day, all day, waking up in the middle of the night sick. Doing a little better now...
Boosie knows..."I quit it, ain't fuckin with it...say that all the time"
He was still pale and sweating but now crying from the pain of precipitated w/d.
I got clean one year and two months ago... I checked myself into rehab the next day and never looked back.
I've been perscribed suboxone since october of last year
Now, Friday will be my 22nd day since my last injection.
Today I have 78 days. My longest clean time from heroin...ever!!!
Today I have a little over nine months clean from IV heroin... This time last year I was sitting in inpatient back in the Chicago area.
I've been clean for almost a year from iv heroin and I remember how hard it was in the beginning and failing multiple times.
i am going to get a therapist maybe that will help, cravings seem to have gotten stronger now at 6 months then they were at 3.
I currently take 20mg opana and 120mg oxycodone daily.
i've been clean for two months today.
im a week off of heroin today, but on sub's.

post_id: of slip ups since deciding to get clean.

verbatim_example: I have 35 days clean. 35 long, hard days.
This is the beginning of my day 7 after about a 3 week relapse.

I've been trying to take another look at my life and my recovery and really see what needs to be done and what needs to change to be successful this time around. I'm realizing that I have some things in my life that need to be dealt with.
The past three years have been hell. I tried so hard to just pretend it didn't happen. But I could only keep it out of my head for so long. My use went up drastically.
I've tried the whole be friends with them just do different things. Turns out I'm capable of that for about a week, 2 tops, before I'm using again.

Every move I made for the next 5 hours or so made me vomit, I couldn't even turn my head without having the urge to puke. Was this an od? ... decided I'm no longer going to indulge in opiates or else I just might kill myself.
I started feeling like I at least needed a break...so I switched to snorting for like a week or so before, and finally quit over the weekend.
